#!/bin/bash
is_prime() {
  number=$1
  if ((number <= 1)); then
    return 1
  elif ((number == 2)); then
    return 0
  else
    for ((i = 2; i * i <= number; i++)); do
      if ((number % i == 0)); then
        return 1
      fi
    done
    return 0
  fi
}

limit_date=$(date --date="7 days ago" +%Y-%m-%d)
total_sum=0

for file in log_files/*.txt; do
  server_id=$(echo "${file#*_}" | awk -F_ '{print $2}')
  file_date=$(echo "${file}" | awk -F_ '{print $(NF-1)}')

  is_prime ${server_id}
  result=$?

  # Check if server id is prime (result equals to 0) and if file date is within the last 7 days.
  if [[ ${result} -eq 0 && ${file_date} > ${limit_date} ]]; then
    sum=$(awk '{s+=$1} END {print s}' "${file}")
    total_sum=$((total_sum + sum ))
  fi
done

echo ${total_sum}
